name: Mixed Bag 17 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [B] | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what country was Adolf Hitler born?
questions.explanation:
Austria.

	He was born in 1889 in Braunau am Inn , Austria-Hungary.

Arabs.

	Universities usually comprise various colleges and professional schools that make up the academic divisions of a institution.

questions.text: What is a sailor's waterproof hat called?
questions.explanation:
Southwester.

	It is a waterproof hat of oilskin or canvas with a broad brim.

questions.text: An emu is a bird native to __________ .
What is the nickname of Hilo, Hawaii?
questions.explanation:
Orchid City.

	A busy seaport and one of the states largest settlements it is also a busy tourist center.

questions.text: Which amendment to the Constitution authorized a federal income tax?
questions.explanation:
16th.

	This was passed under Taft's administration.

questions.text: What famous dancer wrote an autobiography entitled 'Steps In Time'?
questions.explanation:
Fred Astaire.

	He was born Fred Austerlitz in 1889.His autobiography came out in 1959 and he died in 1987.

questions.text: What was the name of the goose in Walt Disney's movie feature '101 Dalmatians'?
questions.explanation:
Lucy.

	The original movie was made in 1961.

questions.text: The World Trade Center in New York City was completed in what year?
questions.explanation:
1973.

	It consisted of 7 buildings and a shopping concourse. The most prominent of the center was tower one which was 1362 feet and the other was 1368 feet.

questions.text: When did the Klondike gold rush occur?
questions.explanation:
1896.

	It occured in the vicinity of Dawson which is where the Klondike and Yukon rivers meet.
